Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
dejumblefs is a FUSE that lets the user mount a virtual directory with the
contents of the original directory, or the results of filtering the original
filesystem. Files can be presented to the user organized by filetype, access
time, metadata, etc. This search an be a shell script (find, locate, etc) or
many other backends as a xesam filter.
info.name: dejumble
info.summary: dejumble: presents an organized view of the contents of a directory.
info.html_description: dejumblefs is a FUSE that lets the user mount a virtual directory with the contents of the original directory, or the results of filtering the original filesystem. Files can be presented to the user organized by filetype, access time, metadata, etc. This search an be a shell script (find, locate, etc) or many other backends as a xesam filter.
